message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyze data on energy consumption from the Global Energy Statistical Yearbook and complement it with satellite imagery to estimate household electrification rates across sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Global Energy Statistical Yearbook", "satellite imagery"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Using a dataset of over 10,000 households in Uganda from the Living Standards Measurement Study, we examine the relationship between access to financial services and household poverty.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion", "Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This paper investigates the effects of public-private partnerships on road infrastructure development in Indonesia, using a dataset of PPP projects from the World Bank Private Participation in Infrastructure (PPI) database.", "dataset": ["World Bank Private Participation in Infrastructure (PPI) database"], "topic": ["Public-Private Partnerships", "Infrastructure"]}, {"sentence": "We use a dataset comprised of firm-level data from the manufacturing industry in Mexico and complement it with environmental data from the National Institute of Ecology and Climate Change to examine the effect of pollution abatement regulations on firm productivity.", "dataset": ["firm-level data from the manufacturing industry in Mexico", "environmental data from the National Institute of Ecology and Climate Change"], "topic": ["Environment"]}, {"sentence": "By combining data from multiple sources including the Global Terrorism Database, we investigate the spatial and temporal dynamics of terrorist attacks in South Asia.", "dataset": ["Global Terrorism Database"], "topic": ["Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "We employ a panel dataset of skilled migration flows from the World Bank Bilateral Migration Matrix and find that migrants' English language proficiency plays a significant role in their choice of destination country.", "dataset": ["World Bank Bilateral Migration Matrix"], "topic": ["Migration"]}, {"sentence": "This study uses household survey data from the Demographic and Health Surveys and satellite imagery data to investigate the impact of climate change on access to safe water sources in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys"], "topic": ["Water", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We explore the relationship between inequality and electoral participation in Latin America, drawing on a dataset comprised of political participation and social indicators from multiple sources including the Inter-American Development Bank.", "dataset": ["political participation and social indicators from multiple sources including the Inter-American Development Bank"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "Using a time-series dataset on agricultural prices from the Food and Agricultural Organization of the United Nations, we examine the effect of market integration on smallholder farmer welfare in rural Kenya.", "dataset": ["Food and Agricultural Organization of the United Nations"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "This paper employs a cross-country panel dataset on renewable energy policies from the International Renewable Energy Agency to compare the effectiveness of various policy instruments in promoting renewable energy uptake across different countries.", "dataset": ["International Renewable Energy Agency"], "topic": ["Energy"]}]

content: [{"sentence": "We analyze data on energy consumption from the Global Energy Statistical Yearbook and complement it with satellite imagery to estimate household electrification rates across sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Global Energy Statistical Yearbook", "satellite imagery"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "Using a dataset of over 10,000 households in Uganda from the Living sources including the Inter-American Development Bank.", "dataset": ["political participation and social indicators from multiple sources including the Inter-American Development Bank"], "topic": renewable energy uptake across different countries.", "dataset": ["International Renewable Energy Agency"], "topic": ["Energy"]}]
